decorator.name: translate
decorator.description: Translates text from a foreign language into another one specified.

options.name: target
options.description: The language you are trying to translate into.

options.name: text
options.description: The contents that you are translating.

options.name: formality
options.description: How formal you want your translation to be.

options.name: format
options.description: Formats your message into a specific structure.

footer.text: This bot utilizes the DeepL API!

embeds.title: Error
embeds.description: The bot encountered an error when trying to handle your translation request.

fields.name: Description
fields.value:
The `/translate` command translates text from a foreign language into another one specified.
This command comes with two required arguments:

> `target` - The language you are trying to translate into.
> `text` - The contents that you are translating.
(Usage: `/translate target: DE text: Hello World!`)

Additionally, the command also comes with two optional arguments:

> `formality` - How formal you want your translation to be.
> `format` - Formats your message into a specific structure.
(Usage: `/translate target: FR text: Hello, I enjoy eating croissants and baguettes from France. formality: Informal format: Continuous sentence.`)
